DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there is functional status of a person's heart, the hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the functional status of a person's heart, the hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.:Function; what something is used for.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).
The normal action performed by a structure or device.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have adequate ca
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate cardiac function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Adequate cardiac function as defined as an ejection fraction 50% as determined by MUGA or echocardiogram

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must not have cardiac disease that would preclude the use of epirubicin or trastuzumab

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Left ventricular ejection fraction >= 50 by gated radionuclide study OR shortening fraction of >= 27% by echocardiogram?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a shortening fraction of < 25% by echocardiogram?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Left ventricular ejection fraction >= 50 by gated radionuclide study OR  shortening fraction of >= 27% by echocardiogram?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was there evidence of poor or low cardiac function at time of initial osteosarcoma diagnosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Left ventricular ejection fraction > 55%  on ECHO?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate cardiac function for patients at risk of receiving doxorubicin containing regimen (C, D, E, F)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have valvular disease with documented compromise in cardiac function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documented Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction of greater than or equal to 45%?
